channel.title: Just a little bit of help please
channel.description: how would i make my stairs actually take me upstairs and make them take me down aswell

item.title: Just a little bit of help please
item.dc:creator: @scottbenton scottbenton
item.source: Just a little bit of help please

item.title: Just a little bit of help please
item.dc:creator: @xx_nub_xx xx nub xx
item.description:
@xx_nub_xx wrote:

basically when you call that void, it would be like this (this is in void objectClick)

case ####:
climb(####, ####, #, "you climb the stairs!");
break;

the “int x”, “int y”, “int height”, and “String message” are just there to make you’re life easier, so you won’t have to declare “int x” every time you want to call that method… make sense now?

Read full topic
item.source: Just a little bit of help please

what does int x, int y mean? and string message /???

i know what the rest means

item.title: Just a little bit of help please
item.dc:creator: @xx_nub_xx xx nub xx
item.description:
@xx_nub_xx wrote:

wow thats a big code for climbing stairs when all u need is

	private void climb(int x, int y, int height, String message) { //or public it doesn't matter
		teleportToX = x;
		teleportToY = y;
		heightLevel = height;
		if(message != null && message != "") {
			sendMessage(message);
		}
	}

Read full topic
item.source: Just a little bit of help please

[code=javascript]//go upstairs

case -1:
if (!IsUsingSkill) {
if (objectID == 1747 || objectID == 1750 || objectID == 4417) {
stairs = 1;
skillX = objectX;
skillY = objectY;
stairDistance = 1;

skillY = objectY;

} else if (objectID == 2492) { /Essence Mine Portals/

skillX = objectX;
skillY = objectY;
stairDistance = 1;
} else if (objectID == 9356) { // tzhaar door to fight caves
teleportToX = 2413;

teleportToX = 2413;
teleportToY = 5117;
} else if (objectID == 2406) { /Lost City Door/

skillX = objectX;
skillY = objectY;
stairDistance = 1;

//Open Door
}
}
}
break;

case -2:
//go downstairs

                                    if (!IsUsingSkill) {
				if (objectID == 1746 || objectID == 1749 || objectID == 4417) {
					stairs = 2;
					skillX = objectX;

					stairDistance = 1;
				} else if (objectID == 1740) {

and make them teleport you (just like a portal would do except it increases the height as well)
